name: The Rogue Defender (Rogue 33 / Dwarven Defender 5 / Fighter 2)
author: Orion

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
This build draft looked interesting:

- High rogue Base AB 40, 6 APR dual wielding shortswords, 19d6 sneak attack (133d6 sneak / round if dual wielding and hasted)
- Nearly 500 base HP, improved evasion, epic dodge, immunity to flanking attacks including sneak attacks
- 345 skill points

Weaknesses include:
- average fort save, low will save
- late knockdown/improved knockdown and weapon focus feats (due to prioritising early ITWF and dwarven defender)

Nice things are incredible sneak damage output, ability to tank for party (especially if he equips a shield), lots of skill points
Not so great things are he will not want to tank dev crits or implosions, UMD or clarity potions will be essential for a soloist to protect the will save.
Sneak immunes might be a pain although undead can be dealt with holy traps/bless weapon/flame weapon scrolls

Feel like there are things that might be able to be done better but I suspect the DD pre-requisites are pushing a number of pre-epic feats to epics is the issue, the solution being pushing more fighter levels but that cuts into sneak damage (which is overkill I know but I am finding it hard to let go of it)

Anyway some nice things here, also some flaws, thought I would share

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
I like good rogue builds - and this one is good.
Still I wonder why you want to take 5 levels of DD here. With 33 Rogue levels, your UD will almost be as good as the dwarven Defensive awareness.
My suggestion is to take CoT instead of DD.
More Fighter and CoT will give you more feats to play with, better saves, EWS and even the option to take saves boosting feats to cover the weaknesses of the build that you point at. But then again there are dozens of Rogue/Fighter/CoT builds out there already - for a good reason, I might add.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hail Mick thanks for exploring this with me
I wanted to explore a different approach to the fighter / rogue / DD combo (usually DD goes to 22 or 26)
Which was to make rogue ultra high
I can look at fighter/rogue/cot builds again as you say they are a dime a dozen
They solve the save and feat problems of rogue
For rogue to go ultra high I will need two 'cheese' classes (low investment, high return)
I thought why not look at some DD 5 cheese, see if that is going to be useful 

Dwarven defensive awareness II from DD 5 provides immunity to flanking, meaning no more flanking sneak attacks, and no more +2 AB bonuses for enemies who flank you
It was an interesting idea for a party who wants a 'big dwarven boy' to tank for them (heh who doesn't). 
And if the enemy don't play along with the game he gets to stick the shortsword in pretty nastily :)
It comes at a cost, the Dodge and Toughness pre-requisites plus ITWF make the pre-epics ultracrowded  -> the main thing I don't like about the build
Yeah more fighter / CoT can solve that with the bonus feats and saves but then I feel GDL's already nailed a very solid rogue build with that combo
I might leave this one to sit here for a while
